sentence.Network_en: For, as without law there is no sin, without eyes there is no indecorum.
sentence.Network_cn: 因为正如没有法律就无所谓罪恶一样, 没有人看也就谈不上什么举止不雅.

sentence.Network_en: A war is no excuse for indecorum.
sentence.Network_cn: 战争不成其为不端行为的借口.

PerfectNetExp.abs: indecision 犹豫indecorum 失礼的言行indefatigable 不倦的
4. commit an indecorum 作了一桩失礼的事5. indecorum n. 无礼, 非礼, 无礼的言行6. 1.impolite; rude; 2.indecorum; irreverence3.[Eu.
indecorousness 低级趣味, indecorum 不规矩, indecorum 不体面

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent. (denoting an indecorous act): from Latin, neuter of indecorus (see indecorous)

auth_sentence.content: They were surprisingly allergic to indecorum, and disinclined to question the status quo.
auth_sentence.res_content: They were surprisingly allergic to indecorum, and disinclined to question the status quo.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: They were surprisingly allergic to indecorum, and disinclined to question the status quo.

auth_sentence.content: This was a flagrant indecorum, and known violation of the order of the festival.
auth_sentence.res_content: This was a flagrant indecorum, and known violation of the order of the festival.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This was a flagrant indecorum, and known violation of the order of the festival.
